recipes.author: Helen Nguyen
recipes.description: A very delicious  Thai food that you will enjoy

Ingredients.ingOne: 4 ounces dry pad thai noodles (rice noodles)
Ingredients.ingThree: 1 large shallot, finely diced ( much better than onion here)
Ingredients.ingSix: 2 eggs, whisked with a fork with a generous 3-finger pinch salt ( if vegan, leave it out)
Ingredients.ingSeven: 6–8 ounces tofu, chicken breast or peeled prawns
Ingredients.ingNine: 2 tablespoons peanut oil, wok oil or coconut oil

Instructions.insOne: COOK NOODLES: Cook noodles according to package instructions (or place rice noodles in a shallow bowl or baking dish and boil enough water to cover them. Cover with boiling water for 7- 8 minutes, until tender, then drain. They don’t have to be totally soft, just bendy and pliable)
Instructions.insTwo: Chop shallot, garlic and ginger and set aside.
Instructions.insThree: Whisk the two eggs in a bowl with a fork and add a generous, 3-finger pinch of salt. Set aside.
Instructions.insFour: Make the Pad Thai Sauce Whisk fish sauce,  rice vinegar, brown sugar and soy sauce.

recipes.author: Laura Chan
recipes.description: A very delicious  Thai food that you will enjoy

Instructions.insOne: Melt 3 tablespoons of the niter kibbeh in a medium stock pot.  Add the onions and cook over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes until golden brown
Instructions.insTwo: Add the garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste and 1 tablespoon of the berbere and cook for 5-7 minutes. Reduce the heat if needed to prevent burning
Instructions.insThree: Add the broth and salt, bring it to a boil, reduce the heat to low and cover and simmer the lentils, stirring occasionally, for 40 minutes (adding more broth if needed) or until the lentils are soft
Instructions.insFive: Stir in the remaining tablespoon of niter kibbeh and berbere. Simmer for a couple more minutes. Add salt to taste
